nodes.name: RiderCategorySidebar
nodes.description: Collapsible navigation sidebar for rider requirement categories

nodes.name: Tour
nodes.description: Represents concert tour creation data captured in the tour wizard. Contains form fields for tour name, date range, and rider document upload. Note: This entity reflects component-local state from Index.tsx, not a persisted data model.
nodes.graphql_schema_physical:
type Tour {
  "Name of the concert tour"
  tourName: String!
  
  "Start date of the tour"
  startDate: String!
  
  "End date of the tour"
  endDate: String!
  
  "Name of the uploaded rider document file"
  riderFileName: String
  
  "Upload status flag indicating if rider document is currently being uploaded"
  isUploading: Boolean!
  
  "Upload progress percentage (0-100) for the rider document"
  uploadProgress: Int!
}

nodes.name: Venue
nodes.description: Represents an event venue with location details and compliance scoring against tour rider requirements. Venues are evaluated for their ability to meet technical and hospitality requirements.
nodes.graphql_schema_physical:
type Venue {
  "Unique identifier for the venue"
  id: ID!
  
  "Name of the venue"
  name: String!
  
  "Location of the venue (city, state/province format)"
  location: String!
  
  "Street address of the venue"
  address: String
  
  "Scheduled date for the event at this venue"
  date: String!
  
  "Compliance score (0-100) indicating how well the venue meets rider requirements"
  compliance: Int!
  
  "Breakdown of compliance items by severity level"
  badges: ComplianceBadge!
  
  "Type of day: show, off, or travel"
  dayType: DayType
  
  "City where the venue is located"
  city: String
  
  "State or province where the venue is located"
  state: String
  
  "ZIP or postal code for the venue"
  zipCode: String
  
  "Country where the venue is located"
  country: String
}

enum DayType {
  "Performance day at the venue"
  SHOW
  
  "Day off with no scheduled performance"
  OFF
  
  "Travel day between venues"
  TRAVEL
}

nodes.name: ComplianceBadge
nodes.description: Represents the categorized breakdown of compliance items for a venue, grouped by severity: red (critical issues), yellow (moderate concerns), green (compliant items).
nodes.graphql_schema_physical:
type ComplianceBadge {
  "Number of critical non-compliance items (compliance score < 40)"
  red: Int!
  
  "Number of moderate compliance concerns (compliance score 40-79)"
  yellow: Int!
  
  "Number of fully compliant items (compliance score >= 80)"
  green: Int!
}

nodes.name: RiderItem
nodes.description: Represents an individual requirement or specification from a tour rider document. Rider items are technical and hospitality requirements that venues must meet, organized by category and subcategory codes.
nodes.graphql_schema_physical:
type RiderItem {
  "Unique identifier for the rider item"
  id: ID!
  
  "Hierarchical code identifying the category and subcategory (e.g., 01.1 for Equipment > Audio)"
  code: String!
  
  "Title or name of the requirement"
  title: String!
  
  "Detailed description of the requirement specification"
  description: String!
  
  "Flag indicating if this item is currently being edited in the UI"
  isEditing: Boolean
  
  "Category this rider item belongs to"
  category: RiderCategory
  
  "Subcategory or section within the parent category"
  subcategory: String
  
  "Timestamp when the rider item was created"
  createdAt: String
  
  "Timestamp when the rider item was last modified"
  updatedAt: String
}

nodes.name: RiderCategory
nodes.description: Represents a top-level category for organizing rider requirements. Categories include Equipment, Facilities, Information, Parking, Local Crew, Logistics, and Production. Some categories have hierarchical subsections.
nodes.graphql_schema_physical:
type RiderCategory {
  "Unique identifier for the category"
  id: ID!
  
  "Display label for the category"
  label: String!
  
  "Optional icon identifier for visual representation"
  icon: String
  
  "List of subsection names within this category (e.g., Audio, Backline for Equipment)"
  subsections: [String!]
  
  "List of rider items that belong to this category"
  items: [RiderItem!]
  
  "Order index for displaying categories in the UI"
  displayOrder: Int
}

"Standard rider categories used in tour management"
enum RiderCategoryType {
  "Technical equipment requirements including Audio, Backline, Lighting, Staging, Video, and Other"
  EQUIPMENT
  
  "Venue facility requirements including dressing rooms, catering areas, and backstage amenities"
  FACILITIES
  
  "General information and documentation requirements"
  INFORMATION
  
  "Parking requirements for tour vehicles, crew, and equipment"
  PARKING
  
  "Local crew staffing requirements including technicians and stagehands"
  LOCAL_CREW
  
  "Logistical requirements for load-in, setup, and load-out"
  LOGISTICS
  
  "Production-specific requirements and technical specifications"
  PRODUCTION
}

edges.label: leads_to_venue_selection
edges.details: conceptual workflow - The tour creation step (Index.tsx) leads to venue selection (SelectVenues.tsx) in the wizard flow. This represents navigation/workflow rather than a data relationship. Note: No actual venues field exists in Tour entity - each page manages independent local state.

edges.label: uploads_rider_for_validation
edges.details: conceptual workflow - The tour creation includes rider document upload (Index.tsx) which is later validated as RiderItems (RiderValidation.tsx). This represents the wizard flow rather than a data relationship. Note: No actual riderItems field exists in Tour entity - the uploaded file is processed separately in the validation step.

edges.label: has_compliance_badge
edges.details: one-to-one - Each venue has exactly one compliance badge that categorizes rider requirement compliance into red (critical), yellow (moderate), and green (compliant) items. The badges field in Venue type contains a ComplianceBadge object.

edges.label: belongs_to_category
edges.details: many-to-one - Each rider item belongs to one category for organizational purposes (Equipment, Facilities, Information, Parking, Local Crew, Logistics, or Production). The category field in RiderItem type references a RiderCategory object.

edges.label: contains_items
edges.details: one-to-many - A rider category can contain multiple rider items. The items field in RiderCategory type contains an array of RiderItem objects that belong to this category. This is the inverse relationship of belongs_to_category.

CreateTourPage manages Tour entity data through form inputs. User can create and update tour details including tourName, startDate, endDate via onChange handlers (Index.tsx:76,92,107). Also manages rider file upload with riderFileName, isUploading, and uploadProgress state (Index.tsx:8-13). Performs CREATE and UPDATE operations on Tour entity.

SelectVenuesPage manages Venue entity creation through venue selection form. User can input venue details including venueName, streetAddress, city, state, zipCode, country via form fields (SelectVenues.tsx:105,122,138,153,168,184). Also manages dayType selection between 'show', 'off', and 'travel' options (SelectVenues.tsx:62-90). Performs CREATE operations on Venue entity.

RiderValidationPage manages RiderItem entities through inline editing functionality. User can edit RiderItem descriptions via handleEditClick (line 75), handleUpdate (line 83), handleCancel (line 93), and handleTextChange (line 105) functions. Updates isEditing flag and description field on RiderItem entities (RiderValidation.tsx:76-103). Performs UPDATE operations on RiderItem collection.

TourReviewPage displays Venue entities in a compliance grid layout. Reads venue data from venues array (TourReview.tsx:26) and renders venue cards showing name, location, date, compliance score, and badges. Also displays venue details in modal when user clicks on a venue card (TourReview.tsx:130-152). Performs READ operations on Venue collection.

TourReviewPage displays ComplianceBadge data within venue cards and calculates total badge counts across all venues. Reads badge properties (red, yellow, green) from each venue's badges field (TourReview.tsx:121-128) and displays them as colored circles with counts. Also aggregates total badges using reduce operation (TourReview.tsx:200-222). Performs READ operations on ComplianceBadge entities.

RiderSidebarComponent displays RiderCategory entities as expandable sections for navigation. Reads category data from sections array (RiderSidebar.tsx:11-23) and renders each category with its label, icon, and subsections. Manages expansion state for Equipment category showing subsections like Audio, Backline, Lighting, Staging, Video, and Other (RiderSidebar.tsx:92-123). Performs READ operations on RiderCategory collection.

VenueListComponent displays a simplified list of Venue entities. Reads venue data from mockVenues array (VenueList.tsx:7-21) and renders each venue showing date, name, and address. This is a read-only display component that maps over the venues collection (VenueList.tsx:26-49). Performs READ operations on Venue collection.
